result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
9:08 AM Defendant Allen M Schutz in court.  Attorney Aaron Thomas Vruwink in court for Allen M Schutz.  Prosecuting attorney David R. Knaapen in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Knaapen gives the court his sentencing recommendation. Attorney Vruwink agrees with the recommendation but argues the jail time. Victims rights have been complied with. Defendant makes a statement to the court.

2:31 PM Defendant Allen M Schutz in court.  Attorney Aaron Thomas Vruwink in court for Allen M Schutz.  Attorney Nathan T. Oswald in court for State of Wisconsin.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Absolute sobriety. No violent or abusive contact w/ victim - TAH.

01:57 PM Defendant Allen M Schutz in court with attorney Andrew G. Slaven.  Defendant Allen M Schutz in custody.  Nathan T. Oswald appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Allen M Schutz appeared by video means with Attorney. Court finds probable cause to continue this matter. Not guilty pleas are entered by the court.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.
